result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Klint was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J Klint is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J Klint was found guilty of Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

phone call from Defendant; he will be coming in to make payments arrangements for unpaid fines.  He has files from 2015 and has a 2017 TR case that has recently suspended his license.  Spoke with BV re: the same.

Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney James D Babbitt.  Defendant in custody.  DOC agent Sandra Frigo in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:45)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentence - deft has done every treatment program available - has substantial jail time credit - agrees with recommendation of dept
14CF47 - 314 days credit
15CF54 - 367 days credit
13CF427 - 168 days credit
15CM441 - was concurrent time
Frigo - has different calculations
14CF47 - 362 days
13CF427 - 168 days
15CF54 - 352 days
15CM441 - 37 days
Rivard agrees except for one matter
14CF47 has 372 days
Rivard argues for time served - the only matter really talking about is 13CF427 other matters time have been served - requests no more then an addtl 30 days on 13CF427, one year on the two felonies and sentence completed on misd. -  allow huber
Deft - addresses the court - believes he's paid about $600 directly to RCU on the restitution

COURT:  14cf47 - 365 days jail - credit 362 days - owe $433.29 made judgment - rest $1152.87 judgment (DOC & deft to check on the actual balance)
15CF54 - 365 days jail - credit 352 days - $318 cc made judg
13CF427 - 320 days - credit 169 days consecutive to the above two - $518 cc made judg
15CM441 - 37 days jail - credit 37 days - $443 cc made judg
HUBER ALLOWED FOR WORK AND TREATMENT
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 22, 2016 at 11:45 am.
DOC requests sentencing after revocation hearing; all files to Br II for scheduling.

Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Evan Thomas Bins Nordgren.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Sandra Frigo DOC agent, Jenae Brantner and Sara Benedict all appeared.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(4:22)
State - deft signed an alternative to revocation - stipulate to terminate treatment court - lift stay on 88 days jail effective Dec 14, 2015
Nordgren - that is the agreement
Klint - understands agreement
Frigo - addresses sentencing - after completion of MSDF deft will return to Dunn Co
Klint - addresses the court

COURT:  approves stipulation
terminates treatment court
lifts stay on 88 days jail effective Dec 14, 2015 to March 10, 2016 as alternative to revocation
return to Dunn Co once completed
email correspondence on dates
Treatment Court Hearing at 02-04-2016 04:15 pm
from treatment court
Treatment Court Hearing at 10-09-2015 01:30 pm
Letter from Janae Brantner

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Christopher R. Bub appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:20)  Sarah, Jenae and Jeremy Treatment Court Coordinators present in court.
State - addresses defendants conduct - requests jail time - treatment court has provided the best treatment it can - high sanction is appropriate - requests 5 day jail sentence
Bub - stipulates that deft admitted use - makes some clarifications 
Court calls Jeremy Davis - sworn - Direct by State
Cross by C. Bub
State - no further witnesses
Bub - calls Glenda Klint - sworn
State - brief cross
Bub - rests
State - argues - requests 5 days jail
Bub - argues - wants to admit himself to L.E. Phillips for treatment - he's called them already and they have space - if must impose jail time only be 1-3 days
Deft - addresses the court - has dentist appt at 2:00 today and wishes to report after appt

COURT:  deft violated the rules & the order that was put in place 
               Orders 3 days jail - forthwith - requests treatment response from Jenae for treatment court next week before Judge Peterson - allows huber for dental appointment but has to report immediately after dental appt
request for Sanction hearing from Jeremy Davis Integrated Treatment Specialist

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Sandra Frigo DOC appeared.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:38)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - deft is open to treatment court and believes it to be appropriate - requests 3 yrs probation - 6 mo jail time stayed - no contact with M. M. 8-13-1983 w/held sentence no contact with D.B. 12-25-1953 N11151 450th St. Boyceville, $518 cc on ea count
13CF427 has 4 days credit 
Frigo - addresses the court
Burger - argues sentencing - deft does very well in structed environment - objects to n/c with M.M.
Frigo - no objection to his associating with M. M. if no one is using
Klint - addresses the court
Frigo - deft is eligible but haven't set up a plan
Brantner - deft has had assessment and is eligible

COURT:
15CF54 Ct 1 
w/held sentence 3 yrs probation
$518 cc - PAYMENT PLAN
credit 92 days
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
9 months jail - stayed
leaving n/c with M.M. up to DOC agent
n/c with D. B. 12-25-1953
n/c with N11151 450th St., Boyceville, WI
allow deft to do treatment court and complete or conditional jail time can be imposed

complete all mental health & AODA & comply as deemed by DOC

13CF427 Ct 1
w/held sent 3 yrs probation - concurrent to 15CF54
$518 cc - PAYMENT PLAN

BOTH COUNSEL WILL MAINTAIN THEIR PSI CONFIDENTIALLY

Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Donna Burger.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:04)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Burger - don't have agreement at this point - prosecutor wasn't available to talk to - she did send an offer - may actually have an agreement but would request PSI - can take the plea today, need to do questionaire
(11:09) break taken
(11:20) recalled
Burger - plea in 15CF54 Ct 1, dismiss Ct 2 & 3 & 14CF371
Deft - 15CF54 Ct 1 pleads guilty - waives rights & JT

COURT:  
13CF427 Ct 1 - DAGP is revoked, ready for sentencing
15CF54 Ct 1 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty according to 2nd amended information (court changed caption)
***ORDERS PSI BE DONE***
Sentencing on both above matters

DISMISS:  15CF54 Ct 2 & 3, 14CF371  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Treatment Court Eligibility Form

COURT:  matter continued - bond continue
all matters continued
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.
